title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine
Interview Descriptions: First round is a phone interview to discuss position and next steps with recruiter, second interview is in person /zoom with supervisors of department and then told you will be notified either way.
Interview Questions: They are big on teamwork, one question was related to how you contribute to team and communicate with team members about conflict.

title: Psychotherapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE)
Interview Descriptions: Fine but slow. They took forever to get back to you and the recruiter didn't answer thier email. It also was very cultural based. It didn't really ask me my experience. I also was one of the first to interview and think they forgot about me.
Interview Questions: How I can be innovative

title: Revenue Integrity Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Quick, thorough, and pleasant. Done via Zoom which is convenient due to the size and difficult parking of Nebraska Medicine! HR recruiter was informative of everything needed prior to interview.
Interview Questions: How I viewed teamwork and collaboration imperative to overall individual success.

title: Medical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE)
Interview Descriptions: I was recruited by the supervisor and the interview process was very smooth. They were friendly and allowed me to talk with other social workers who were working there to get their opinions.
Interview Questions: What was one thing I wanted to get out of the position.

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straightforward. Initial Zoom, second round was in person. Manager and director present initially with physician panel on the second round. I would not be nervous going into it but be prepared for scenario questions.
Interview Questions: Focused on their 'ITEACH' acronym. Innovation, Teamwork, Excellence, Accountability, Courage, Healing.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Just asked informal questions and tells you about the position . Interview was really laid back. Also told about what the other people did in the office. The lady was really nice and straightforward about everything.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you had miscommunication and how did you solve it

title: HR Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral based interview process as well as skills etc. Multiple interviews for same position with various people within that department. Overall a normal process for most companies. Denial letters take time, if received at all.
Interview Questions: What about this position interested me.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: 5 questions, one of the questions was to name a time you had a problem and how to solve it. All of the 5 questions relate to the core values of Nebraska Medicine. The interview was a zoom meeting and very relaxed.
Interview Questions: “What was one problem you’ve encountered and how did you solve it?”

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very good interview process, detailed, with a lot of room for me to ask questions in return and to learn more about the department. I would recommend applying for the various positions if qualified.
Interview Questions: Interacting with staff and patient questions.

title: App Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Timely responses, great recruiter, kind interview team, straight forward manager, enjoyable process, took the time to get to know me and my interests. At least two interview panels and had peers, leads, and other managers
Interview Questions: Focuses on org values and skills fit

title: Patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Process was fast from 1st phone interview to in person interview and job offer with the whole process taking 3 days. I had performed this job prior and like how they changed the title along with some of the responsibilities. I turned down the job due to them low balling me on pay. They came in almost $1/hour under what I told them at the start of the interview process. I understand labor is expensive and would not have wasted any ones time if I had known that my pay needs would not have been met.
Interview Questions: What was something that you had difficulty learning and how did you over come that?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Two step process. Very informative to the job title. It was to the point and answered any questions I had. The energy was upbeat and genuine. I was given a time frame for decisions and next steps.
Interview Questions: A time that I had to think outside the box and problem solve a situation.

title: Mobile App Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview was over the phone. Very casual with a few basic questions on my interest in the position and the company, work history, and some tips on what to expect for the second interview which was scheduled before the end of the phone call.
Interview Questions: What interests you about this position and working for NMC?

title: RN Emergency Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Simple phone screening after submission of the application. Actual interview was done on Zoom with two managers. The interview lasted about an hour and was rather informal, yet very structured.
Interview Questions: When was a time you made a mistake and what did you do about it?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the website, and received a call less than a week later. The interview was set up for that same week. During my experience, I had to meet with the physicians, current role holder, and the department manager. I received an answer about the role about a week after that.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that you had to deal with an upset patient or family member, and how did you deal with it?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine
Interview Descriptions: It went very smoothly and the whole process took about 2 weeks. They had me complete a recorded online interview which they reviewed and then contacted me for an in person interview. The interview took about 30 minutes and it was just with the floor manager.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work at Nebraska Medicine?

title: Patient Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an email back couple days later. someone called me to just ask background questions and set up a real interview time. I haven't gone through the actual interview yet Im still waiting for mine
Interview Questions:
Are you familiar with the job description

Why this job?

title: RN Postpartum Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine
Interview Descriptions: 2 Interviews. One by phone and the second by zoom.  The first interview they asked me 3 questions. 1. Why do I want to work at NE medicine? 2. Tell me a time you had to step up. 3. Tell me a time when you had to compromise.
Interview Questions: Did not have an interview yet.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Very quick to respond. I haven't gone through it yet here for the next realm have a great job there is no way I could have went you have a great time to argue #ludacrisvsnelly and the lady is the same myself I have to say I was just the
Interview Questions: Waiting in call back. Have not had a chance to answer.

title: Scheduling Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: over zoom meeting with the lead and the boss. was comfortable and easy going. Asked normal questions for an interview and then was nice to get to know the staff
Interview Questions: what my goals were in a job

title: Clinic RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Interview consisted of several pre-scripted questions, brief description of the job and one question in regards to why the position was of interest. There was nothing personal about the interview to get to know the person or get a sense of any professional capability.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you miscommunicated something to someone and how it was handled.

title: MedicalReceptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: it was a 30 min interview, interviewers were nice.  I felt like the manager was more impressed with the way I answered the interview questions.  However, the supervisor did not seem like it
Interview Questions: why do you want to work for Nebraska Medicine

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very welcoming they answered all questions I asked and let me shadow to see what a typical day would be like. After the shadow experience was the 1 on 1 interview
Interview Questions: Safety, Responsibilities, Privacy

title: Talent Acquisition Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: This was probably one of the most positive candidate experiences I’ve had in a very long time. The recruiter was phenomenal from start to finish. Even though I wasn’t offered, I enjoyed the experience!
Interview Questions: Tell me about your leadership style?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Had a panel of three people for the interview. Two weeks after the interview job shadowed. Didn't hear anything for three weeks. Attempted to call HR to get clarification, but never heard back.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest accomplishment?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Bellevue, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Two days after applying I received a phone call from the recruiter, had a brief 10 minute pre-interview. Offered a formal interview with manager/educator. Had a tour of unit, then interview. Awaiting call back.
Interview Questions: Explain a time you made a mistake

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: easy. not too bad. I thought it would be more challenging. I liked the people I interviewed with (and now work with). I thought I would be asked more about my experience with research and coordinating patient recruitment and follow up.
Interview Questions: experience with patient interaction

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: We Waited over a month to hear from recruiter and still got the run around for another few months. Multiple recruiters involved who were very unorganized and didn't talk to each other.
Interview Questions: Current salary

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE)
Interview Descriptions: Please see below for the stages of the interview process. The primary component of the interview included a one on one discussion with the supervisor of the occupational therapy department.
Interview Questions: Asked questions regarding critical thinking skills related to position. Good intereview.

title: Molecular Lab Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE)
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the the Lead Technologist, Manager, Technical Supervisor, and Medical Director in a group interview setting. They has a list of generic interview questions they went through and added had other questions that concerned my background and how I interacted with people from both a co-worker stance and more of a client stance. They are looking to see if you fit the role and whether you fit in with the current staff.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict among co-workers?

title: Patient Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: You apply online and wait for a response from the reccruiting lady. Then i went in for an interview which was about a week after I got a call. It did take them a while to get back to me a little over 3 weeks. The interview was very easy it was a one on one so a comfortable enviroment.
Interview Questions: If we called your manager what are three words they would describe you as?

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: We visited for some time.  I was asked questions, and I also asked questions, such as hours, training involved, type of people I will serve.  I took a tour of the office where I would work.  I communicated very well with the interviewer, and she was kind and considerate to me.  It was interesting to learn more about the company I would be working for.
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied using the online website which gave no specifics about the position. I was called in for the interview, and was told they used a behavioral approach to interviewing. A lot of questions of "What would you do if...?"
Interview Questions: How I would manage working with strong personalities, particularly if a physician started yelling at me?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with 5 staff members in a semi-circle around me. Roughly 15-20 questions were asked, I was given an opportunity to ask questions and then I was given a brief tour of the department. The interview was very well organized and there was nice fluidity throughout the whole process.
Interview Questions: If asked, what would a patient say about you?

title: Evs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The manager was very nice she look professional and when I was hired she was the only manager that would actually help out. She was generous she come up to get me for the interview.
Interview Questions: How to clean a toilet.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very comfortable not intimidating, friendly, questions were direct and related to the position. Explained expectations of the job. and in lighted on possibility of the future plans. did not tour area, Explained growth moving to new building and combination of inpatient and outpatient area's.
Interview Questions: Prior experience  related to the position

title: Oncology Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: An hour and a half interview, first it was one on one, the second part was a group interview, it wasn't bad at all, and I am a fairly shy person.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself...

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with only the manager in her office. It was very relaxed and non-intimidating. I was asked the generic interview questions like, "why do you want to work here" and "what is a strength/weakness that you have." The manager also asked  me what kind of environment I wanted to work in and what my ideal preceptor would be like. The interview ended with an unofficial offer!
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to work as a team and what was your role?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met w group of nurses who did interview of people they would be working with. Did tour of facility and met with manager who talked  about her background. Comfortable low key working environment compared to  larger facility. staff seemed very at ease and not stressed. Good location. Parking readily available. Close to shopping and fast food if desired. Very clean and quiet.
Interview Questions: What is your outlook in the next year? What would you like to be doing.

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE)
Interview Descriptions: Met with the hiring manager and two of the people in the department. They talked the whole time and only asked a few questions about me and my experience. They were selling the job to me more than I had to sell myself to them. The interview was conducted in the open. We were never behind closed doors.
Interview Questions: Do you think you will need more than 45 minutes for lunch?

title: Certified Nurse Assistant, CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Interviewed via phone, brought in to interview in person with unit manager. Follow up from HR with decision. It was very straight forward and easy to understand. They verified credentials, drug screen/physical.
Interview Questions: How are you with time management?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I was extended an interview after a phone call from the hiring department. Before I was offered an interview, I was asked about my intentions to complete my bachelor  degree in nursing. I said that I was actively applying to schools.
The interview was scheduled with the Nurse Manager, Department Manager, and HR. After the interview, I was given a tour of the department.
Interview Questions: What do you do when there is down time at work?

title: Staff Nurse, ICU Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Omaha, NE) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I first had a telephone interview with an HR person who reviewed my resume'. Then I had an appointment with the ICU Unit Manager and the Associate Nurse Manager. After that we took a tour of the unit and the facility and I was allowed to speak with the nurses on duty to ask questions. Very friendly, informal process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a customer and how did you deal with it?

title: One Chart Team Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Nebraska Medicine (Bellevue, NE) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: In my case, I was a traveling nurse, and was out of town when the manager and a team of peers did a phone interview with me.  It was exceptional that they took the time to conduct an unusual interview, and it really made me think that the organization was very progressive.  Definitely stood out in the crowd that way.
Interview Questions: Tell us a situation where there was conflict, but you helped to resolve it, and how did you do that.
